info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 7:43AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Glynn County through 815 AM EDT... At 742 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout near St. Simons Island and over Sea Island, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... St. Simons Island and Sea Island. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
